articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Israeli military said on Monday it was conducting extensive strikes against targets of the Iranian-backed Hezbollah movement in Lebanon, which come amid some of the heaviest cross-border exchanges of fire in nearly a year of conflict.
articles.title: Israeli military says it is striking Hezbollah targets in Lebanon

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Iran's elite Revolutionary Guards Corps (IRGC) has ordered all members to stop using any type of communication devices after thousands of pagers and walkie-talkies used by its Hezbollah allies in Lebanon blew up in deadly attacks last week, two senior Iranian security officials told Reuters.
articles.title: Exclusive: Iran's Guards ban communications devices after strike on Hezbollah, security officials say

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least 56 civilians have been killed and 266 wounded during Ukraine's seven-week-old incursion into Russia's western Kursk region, the Russian Foreign Ministry said on Monday.
articles.title: Russia says 56 civilians killed in Ukraine's seven-week incursion in Kursk region

articles.author: Tom Balmforth
articles.description: President Volodymyr Zelenskiy will set out a "victory plan" to his closest ally this week, in an urgent attempt to influence White House policy on Ukraine's war with Russia no matter who wins the November U.S. elections.
articles.title: Ukraine's Zelenskiy heads to US with 'victory plan' at perilous moment

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi
articles.description: Two strikes by Israeli forces killed at least 10 Palestinians, including four children, in the central Gaza Strip on Monday, medics said, as heavy rains flooded displaced residents' tent encampments.
articles.title: Israel strikes Gaza as heavy rain worsens misery of displaced Palestinians

articles.author: Monica Machicao
articles.description: Wildfires in Bolivia are now running on a track to set an all-time record, latest satellite data show, with fire hot-spots to-date overtaking the rate in the same period during major blazes in 2010 as the wider South American region burns.
articles.title: Bolivia wildfires set to blaze past record as forests burn

articles.author: Andrew Goudsward
articles.description: The man accused of hiding out with a gun near Donald Trump's Florida golf course in an apparent attempt to assassinate the former U.S. president is due in court on Monday, where prosecutors will argue to keep him in jail until his trial.
articles.title: Trump attempted assassination suspect Ryan Routh to appear in court

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: U.S. prosecutors investigating the second assassination attempt on former President Donald Trump say the suspect's cell phone pinged towers near Trump's golf course and his Florida home repeatedly from Aug. 18 to Sept. 15, according to a court filing on Monday.
articles.title: US prosecutors give details on cell phone used in Trump assassination attempt

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Tropical Storm John is rapidly growing and is set to become a hurricane by Monday afternoon as it barrels toward Mexico's Pacific coast, according to the U.S.-based National Hurricane Center (NHC).
articles.title: Storm John to become hurricane as it speeds toward Mexico's Pacific coast

articles.author: Phil Stewart
articles.description: The United States is sending a small number of additional troops to the Middle East given escalating tensions between Israel and Lebanon's Hezbollah, the Pentagon said on Monday, declining to specify the precise number or mission of the deployed forces.
articles.title: US sends additional forces to Middle East as tensions soar, Pentagon says
